description:
My team colleague Xavier Strottner and I are delighted and incredibly proud to present our latest discovery, the new faint candidate for a planetary nebula in the constellation Hydra, which has been catalogued by Pascal Le DÃ» as " STROTTNER-DRECHSLER 47" (StDr47).
Although the object is undoubtedly a real planetary nebula, a spectrum will definitely confirm its status.

***

From the discovery to the finished photo it was a long and difficult way.
Many, many dozens of working hours were necessary, research, analysis, programming of the telescope, monitoring of the photos in a total of 8 nights, spread over April and May 2020 and of course the hours of processing the photos. But considering this wonderful discovery, we can say that the exertions were worth it.

***

STROTTNER-DRECHSLER 47
Coordinates: 09:27:31.485 -23:22:34.44
Constellation: Hydra
Diameter 4 arc minutes

Total exposure time: 28 hours
-12.3 hours H-alpha
-12.7 hours OIII
-3 hours RGB

Telescope: 1m RC, Chilescope
Camera: fli 16803 proline
title: NEW DISCOVERY: Strottner-Drechsler 47 - the Beehive Nebula
